259452.name: Dr. W. Wehchen und Frollein Dinkel
259452.notes_html:
Dr. W. Wehchen und seine Assistientin Frollein Dinkel sind die freundlichen Helfer bei kleinen Wehwehchen, denn in ihrem Körper ist Platz für ein Wärme-oder Kühlkissen.
Aber zunächst können die Beiden super als Handpuppen verwendet werden, so werden der Doktor und das Frollein lebendig und muntern bestimmt jeden kleinen Patienten bei der Visite auf.

Erst dann kommt das kühlende oder wärmende Kissen hinein.
So lindern sie Beschwerden bei kleinen Wehwechen. Helfen bei Zahnweh, Bauchweh, Insektenstichen und Prellungen, wärmen das Bettchen und helfen beim Einschlafen. Kühlen die Stirn bei Fieber… sie sind immer da, wenn Wärme oder Kälte gebraucht wird! Natürlich erstetzen sie keinen Arztbesuch!

Übrigens haben sie gar nichts dagegen, wenn sie einfach nur so gekuschelt werden ;-)

Mit dieser detailliert bebilderten Häkelanleitung kannst du dir ganz leicht so eine niedliche Hülle für Körnerkissen und Kühlpads häkeln. Die Größe ist variabel, passend für Kissen und Kompressen bis zu 15 x 20 cm. Eine Gratis-Anleitung zum Nähen eines Körnerkissens gehört zu dem Ebook dazu.

Materialbedarf:
°Baumwollgarn (LL 125m/50g, z.B. Catania von Schachenmayr) und eine Häkelnadel Stärke 2
°Füllwatte und schwarzes Stickgarn
°Kalt/Warm Kompresse und/oder Körnerkissen, Biegeplüsch
Die Größe ist flexibel, sie richtet sich nach der Größe deines Körnerkissens oder der Kalt/Warm Kompresse.
Folgende Häkelkenntnisse sollten vorhanden sein: Luftmaschen, Kettmaschen, feste Maschen, Maschenzunahme, häkeln in Spiralrunden, sowie in Hin- und Rückreihen

users.about_me:
Häkeln macht Spaß!

Seit 2008 entwerfe ich Amigurumis, kleine Häkelfiguren, zu denen ich Häkelanleitungen schreibe. Meine fertigen Projekte arrangiere ich liebevoll und setze sie in Szene, um sie zu fotografieren und biete sie dann als E-Book Datei zum Nacharbeiten an.

Meine zweite Leidenschaft ist das Malen, meine Lieblingstechnik die Aquarellmalerei. Ich spiele gerne mit Farbschichten, entwickle das Aquarell mit Linien und zusätzlichen Elementen weiter oder kombiniere es mit anderen Medien und Techniken. Manchmal erwecke ich kleine Figuren aus meinen Bildern mit Garn und Häkelnadel zum Leben. Ich mag Buntes, Kleines, Perlen, Papier, Glas, die Sterne, das Meer, Katzen, Gänseblümchen und ich bin einfach gerne kreativ...

Häkel und gestalte Einzigartiges und habe ganz viel Spaß beim Nacharbeiten meiner Anleitungen im pdf-Format.   

Der Verkauf von individuell gefertigten Kreationen, die nach den Häkelanleitungen von KristinasArt entstehen ist erlaubt, vorausgesetzt, sie werden vom Käufer der Anleitung persönlich handgefertigt und sind mit folgendem Verweis versehen: „Hergestellt nach der Anleitung von Kristina Lehne www.crazypatterns.net/de/store/KristinasArt“

473843.name: Twiddlemuff
473843.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
473843.notes_html:
Can be made with any yarn, though chunky is best. This is a great way to use up leftovers

Let your creativity run wild!

Add buttons, tassels, twiddly bits, texture, or anything that encourages twiddling.

This pattern is a pdf on the Internet Archive -- Wayback Machine. Click the “Open” button after you follow the link to open the pdf. If the pattern does not open, try using a different device or browser. Archive links can be temperamental.

Using some devices, eg iPhone, iPad, you need to click ‘about this capture’ at the top of the Wayback page, then on the URL that appears on the drop-down bar.

483683.name: Autism Awareness Bear & Weighted Lap Pad
483683.notes_html:
This pattern bundle includes instructions for crocheting two very cute autism awareness items;
A) A cute and cuddly teddy bear amigurumi with a puzzle piece belly
B) A weighted lap pad (includes instructions for sewing a microwavable rice bag insert) with written & graph instructions

These adorable items are perfect for any child with autism (or sensory processing disorder), or any caring individual that wants to crochet for a cause!

The weighted lap pad is intended to ease & comfort children with anxiety or restlessness and can easily be carried on the go (to restaurants, in the car, etc) as it weighs about 1.75-2lbs.

Promotion - for the month of April (autism awareness month) receive a $1 discount applied automatically in your cart!

It’s OK to be different!! :D

Please note: this pattern requires a basic knowledge of crochet (ch, sc, sc2tog) and of changing colours while working in the round and in rows. The weighted lap pad insert requires basic sewing skills and some extra materials (sew on velcro, cotton fabric, and rice or polly pellets).

users.about_me:
I am a bit of a science nerd (finishing up my PhD - if only I could stop crocheting and focus!) 
I thought crocheting looked fun, so I taught myself using youtube videos...and then got started :) 

**Favorite Yarn**: Anything I can touch and say "oohh soft!" or is just beautiful 
**Favorite Animals**: Monkeys, Hippos (maybe zoo animals in general!?), and cute owls (not the creepy scary wise looking ones!) 
**Favorite food**: Fruit! Seafood (crab is my all-time fav), Italian, Chinese, West Indian...OK, I basically just LOVE food :) 
**Favorite Season**: Fall and Spring 
**Favorite Snack**: I prefer salty to sweet, but totally find moments that I want each. There aren't many snacks I don't like either! (except maybe peanut butter)
**Favorite Music**: Lately - 90's 
**Favorite Drinks**: Coffee (If anyone can find packets of Sanka coffee - feel free to send them along!!), herbal teas, Perier  

I love things that are handmade (especially!!) and things that are useful! Nice notebooks, stitchmarkers, craft supplies, every type of bag or container, anything handmade, and of course yarn (I use primarily worsted weight, but I love it all)!! Also, if we are swapping and you want to include something from your country/state/province - please do! I love having things to remember my swap buddies by! Please don't feel obligated to *buy* anything! Most of my absolute favorite things aren't store-bought anyways ;)

users.about_me:
I graduated from a textile degree from Huddersfield university back in 2018 where amongst many things I specialised in knitting.
I love all things wool related, but am most at home with my DPNs and a good doll pattern.

Favourites yarns are Hayfields Bonus DK and King Cole's merino DK... oh, and my own hand dyed skin tone wools for dolls.

I also love working on my knitting machines and use Designaknit 9.

When not drowning in wool I am found designing textile patterns and running a little quilting project called quilts of hope.

More information is on the website www.bettyvirago.com

579132.name: Boo-boo Buddies
579132.notes_html:
These caring critters are ready to apply some cool and soothing help for little bumps and bruises. Filled with dry beans, these all natural, soft, and adorable cotton ice packs provide 10–15 minutes of gentle, cooling relief when stored in the freezer!

Skill level: Beginner

Finished measurements: 7” tall x 4” wide

Materials

• 1 skein Crème de la Crème by Red Heart, 100% cotton (125 yds/70.9g) in each of colors 331 Fudge Brown (A), 118 Linen (B), 679 Spruce (C), 701 Orchid Pink (D), 870 Cornflower Blue (E), 1 White (F), 12 Black (G)
• U.S. size F-5 (3.75mm) crochet hook
• Yarn needle
• 2 cups dried beans
• Black felt
• Fabric glue

pattern_author.name: Megan Kreiner
pattern_author.notes:
Started in 2012, the brands of MK Crochet and MK Knits feature the toy design work of artist, animator, and author Megan Kreiner. During lunch breaks and after her kids are tucked into bed at night, Megan picks up her sketch book (or iPad) and yarn and designs toys that encourage imaginative and safe play for children (and adults) of all ages.

Her crochet and knit patterns have been featured in numerous books, crochet and knitting magazines, crochet kits, and a series of Creative Bug video tutorials.

Megan received a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in computer graphics and animation from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst, and has worked in the feature animation industry in Los Angeles, California as an animator for studios such as Dreamworks Animation and Disney Feature Animation. Her film credits include titles like DreamWorks Animation’s How to Train your Dragon, Kung Fu Panda, and Trolls and Walt Disney Animation's Raya and the last Dragon, Encanto, and Wish.

Megan lives in Los Angeles, California, with her husband Michael, her children, James and Emily, and Olive the cat.

621209.name: Hypistelymuhvi sisävuorella (Twiddle muff)
621209.gauge_description: 12 stitches and 16 rows = 4 inches in Sileää neuletta
621209.notes_html:
Voihan hypistelymuhvi, elämän ilo ja rakas asia! Miten voikin yksinkertainen juttu olla niin kiinnostava sekä tekijöille että vastaanottajille.

Oli helmikuun alkupuolen lauantai 2015 ja sukkuloin huvikseni pitkin poikin Facebookia eri neulontaryhmissä. Eräässä englanninkielisessä ryhmässä oli tehty twiddle muff, kiinnostuin ja aloin kaivamaan lisää tietoa. Muhvihan on aivan mieletön idea! Kun vielä löysin mukaan Tarja Parviaisen, Eija Sinkkosen ja Kirsi Asikaisen sekä Pohjois-Karjalan Muisti ry:n ja Pohjois-Karjalan Martat ry:n niin tiimi oli kasassa. Siitä se sitten lähti ja huhtikuussa hypistelymuhvit lanseerattiin yhdessä Joensuun kaupungin vapaaehtoistoiminnan kanssa. Tällä hetkellä tekijöitä ja kampanjoita on joka puolella Suomea, muhveja on tehty varmaankin tuhansia. Siis tuhansia, aivan uskomatonta!

Twiddle muff eli vapaasti suomennettuna Hypistelymuhvi on kehitetty mm. dementiaa sairastaville.
Muistisairauteen voi liittyä levotonta motorista käyttäytymistä, jota voidaan lievittää virikkeitä lisäämällä.
Hypistelymuhvi antaa tekemistä levottomille käsille, jolloin muistisairautta sairastava henkilö voi rauhoittua.

Muhviin on kiinnitetty käsien toimintaa aktivoivia esineitä, esim. nappeja, pallotupsuja ja virkattuja kuvioita jne. Esineitä voidaan kiinnittää sekä ulko- että sisäpuolelle eli käsiä voi lämmitellä muhvin sisällä ja samalla hypistellä. Lisäksi erilaiset värit, muodot ja materiaalit tuovat virikkeitä myös näköaistin kautta.

pattern_author.name: Sari Suvanto
pattern_author.notes:
Moi,
Olen elämäntapaneuloja ja neulesuunnittelija Pohjois-Karjalasta. Villasukat ovat erikoisalaani ja kirjani Sukkaset suureksi iloksi ilmestyi vuonna 2021. Ammennan inspiraatiota väreistä, perinteistä ja karjalaisesta perinnöstäni.

Instagramista ja Facebookista löydät minut @langanrytmi

Hi! 
I’m Sari, knitwear designer from Finland and specialising on sock patterns. My first book was published in 2021. Mostly my patterns are in Finnish. I love tradition and heritage patterns, my designs are usually full of colors and I am greatly inspired by the rich tradion of Karelia region.

You can follow my work on Instagram and Facebook @langanrytmi

621210.name: Hypistelymuhvi ilman vuorta (Twiddle muff)
621210.gauge_description: 12 stitches and 16 rows = 4 inches in Sileää neuletta
621210.notes_html:
Voihan hypistelymuhvi, elämän ilo ja rakas asia! Miten voikin yksinkertainen juttu olla niin kiinnostava sekä tekijöille että vastaanottajille.

Oli helmikuun alkupuolen lauantai 2015 ja sukkuloin huvikseni pitkin poikin Facebookia eri neulontaryhmissä. Eräässä englanninkielisessä ryhmässä oli tehty twiddle muff, kiinnostuin ja aloin kaivamaan lisää tietoa. Muhvihan on aivan mieletön idea! Kun vielä löysin mukaan Tarja Parviaisen, Eija Sinkkosen ja Kirsi Asikaisen sekä Pohjois-Karjalan Muisti ry:n ja Pohjois-Karjalan Martat ry:n niin tiimi oli kasassa. Siitä se sitten lähti ja huhtikuussa hypistelymuhvit lanseerattiin yhdessä Joensuun kaupungin vapaaehtoistoiminnan kanssa. Tällä hetkellä tekijöitä ja kampanjoita on joka puolella Suomea, muhveja on tehty varmaankin tuhansia. Siis tuhansia, aivan uskomatonta!

Twiddle muff eli vapaasti suomennettuna Hypistelymuhvi on kehitetty mm. dementiaa sairastaville.
Muistisairauteen voi liittyä levotonta motorista käyttäytymistä, jota voidaan lievittää virikkeitä lisäämällä.
Hypistelymuhvi antaa tekemistä levottomille käsille, jolloin muistisairautta sairastava henkilö voi rauhoittua.

Muhviin on kiinnitetty käsien toimintaa aktivoivia esineitä, esim. nappeja, pallotupsuja ja virkattuja kuvioita jne. Esineitä voidaan kiinnittää sekä ulko- että sisäpuolelle eli käsiä voi lämmitellä muhvin sisällä ja samalla hypistellä. Lisäksi erilaiset värit, muodot ja materiaalit tuovat virikkeitä myös näköaistin kautta.

673816.name: Loom Knitted Twiddle Muff
673816.notes_html:
Twiddle Muffs, or sensory bands, are knitted or crocheted hand muffs decorated with interesting bits and bobs like beads, buttons, ribbons, flowers, zips, pompoms, etc, that have been designed to provide people with dementia something to sooth restless hands, minimize agitation, and promote brain stimulation while keeping their hands warm at the same time.
I became interested in this topic because my mother was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s, and wanted to make a twiddle muff for her. All the patterns I found were for knitted, or crocheted twiddle muffs, but not for loom knitting, so I decided to make my own pattern based on the instructions I found.

These instructions are for a basic twiddle muff, and you can customize it by using different texture stitch patterns, and yarns. This pattern is perfect for using up left over, and odd balls of yarn, and trying out different stitch patterns alternating knit and purl stitches.

Skill level:
Beginners. You need to know how to cast on, bind off, e-wrap knit, purl, sew the cast on and bind of ends.

Measurements:
14”-15” circumference, and 12” long.

Loom: I used the Authentic Knitting Board All-in-One loom, with a 3/8” gauge, but you can use any loom and yarn you have. Make a swatch, and use your gauge to get the correct measurements.

Yarn: Use different colors and textured worsted weight yarns. For this sample I used Red Heart Super Saver, Eye lash yarn paired with one strain of sock yarn, and Caron One Pound for the body, and sport yarn for some of the crocheted decorations.

Notions: loom hook, row counter, yarn needle.

Decorations: beads, buttons, textured ribbon, flowers, zippers, loops, pompoms, etc. Those need to be things that will not break, and are not sharp to touch, or brittle.

680836.name: Tunisian Twiddle Muff
680836.notes_html:
Twiddle muffs are used in many dementia wards and care homes. The different textures of the yarn and accessories attached to the muff provide relief, stimulation and distraction to dementia patients.

This pattern provides instructions for a basic muff. You can then add all sorts of items to the inside and outside, such as buttons, ribbons, pom-poms etc. Add as many things as you like – the more the better as the variety of texture is what helps the dementia patients. The stitches described could be used in a different order for alternative effects.

Any yarn can be used with the appropriate sized hooks.

The main body of the piece is worked in Tunisian crochet. It is seamed together and borders are added to the two openings using standard crochet.

A knowledge of basic Tunisian crochet techniques and stitches (TSS, TKS and TPS) is required.

687649.name: Twiddle Fidget Bag
687649.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 10 rows = 1 inch in 5 sts and 5 rows
687649.notes_html:
FUN and CREATIVE!
Since ladies love their handbags, I was asked to make some ‘sensory twiddle handbags’, similar to the Twiddle muffs for the Dementia patients at our local hospital.
As a SaLT I also have 10+years experience in care homes and both my parents had Alzheimer’s, so I have developed this FREE pattern which provides purposeful activity, and sensory stimulation. The bags also help to distract hospital dementia patients from fiddling with their catheters and bandages.

The 5mm needles suggested are for those who use Aran weight yarn for the handles, instead of chunky. Handles can be sewn across or at one side of the bag.

I add similar twiddle muff embellishments such as a curtain ring on a length of tape; a pom pom on a length of icord; I knitted a little ‘wallet’ with clothing labels sewn inside; beads and some pearl beading, plus a toggle clasp; some braid to twiddle with and a fluffy, elasticated hair band, squeeze stress ball etc. See here for more idess

It’s a chance to use up left over yarns and charity shop ‘finds’ with doubled strand of Double Knit or one strand of Chunky weight yarn and to get creative with beads, buttons, ribbons and other embellishments that will provide the person with dementia some interest and occupation.

If you contact your local hospital and nursing homes, I’m sure they would appreciate you making some of these for the dementia sufferers in their care.
Thank you.

Please feel free to contact me with any queries. I hope you enjoy unleashing your creativity as much as I have with this project.

users.fave_colors: blue, teal, fuschia pink, rose pink
users.about_me:
I learned to knit at age 10 yrs and up until 2009, had always been a sporadic knitter; losing my place in patterns because I did not write anything down or use row counters etc., eventually abandoning the half finished projects to the attic. My UK Grandma, Betsy, taught me to **crochet** at the age of 7 yrs and again after making a few blankets over the years, I didn't really pick it up again until 2010. I spent the time between on other textile projects, instead. 

When I became friends with Sally, who had been knitting since she was 7 yrs old, my knitting interest rekindled. I also found a great weekly magazine to follow. 
In 2011. I found some fabulous knitting friends in a local knitting group, have become quite addicted and completed *several* projects with their support and friendship.

I like to try various designs and projects from knitwear to toys so that I practice stitches/techniques and different types of needles. I am also improving my crochet skills with the help of Ravelry.

You can see my first ever completed project Geometric mohair sweater when I was 21 yrs and the second one, Love's True Knit, for my truly intended!

690540.name: Railway Twiddle Pouch
690540.notes_html:
FUN and CREATIVE- Designed with male sensory impaired who enjoy railways.
It incorporates similar embellishment ideas to the Basic Twiddle bag and Twiddle muff patterns with a railway themed twist.

YARNS: Main bag colour: Robin DK Forest 045 or Royal 086
Fire Box door and surround; chimney: Black 044
Fire Box flames: King Cole Moments Eyelash Fluffy Yarn 1876 Ginger or 487 Orange or any equivalent textured orange yarn
Buffer Beam: Poppy 018
Steam: Sirdar Touch Fleecy Cream 06, Sirdar Snuggly Snowflake Chunky white 063
Coals ¼” black pompom ribbon removed from ribbon and sewn as cluster of coals on side of pouch.

Buffers 2 x 2”/ 5cm circles of machine washable black cotton fabric and two ¾” Doll joints with safety backs. It may sound obvious, but please DO NOT ATTACH SAFETY BACKS until instructed to do so.

Railway signal colour ribbons in red, black, white and yellow;
Firebox door lock: black wooden toggle
Railway lights Beads in green, orange red, thin ¼” length thin, black cord
Name label /‘tickets’ - old clothing labels on ¼” length cream tape,
Firebox: soft machine washable fabric -3½” square;
Fire crackle: cellophane wrapper 2¾” square
Loco wheels: 2 x 0.6mm wooden buttons and 3 x 1” wooden buttons
Wooden letter beads that spell ‘steam’ or ‘coal’,
metal curtain ring on ¼”” length silver or black 0.6mm cord
Squeezy stress ball, attached to length of cord inside mail bag 3 x 8” length soft fabric

TECHNIQUES used: ICord; Garter St; Stocking Stitch; coils/ curls in knit or crochet, in-the-round knitting and straight knitting.Button.

714150.name: Elsie The Texture Teddy
714150.sizes_available: Elsie is 40cm or 16 inches when standing, and 30cm or 12 inches when sitting
714150.notes_html:
Elsie The Texture Teddy is perfect for older people who like to keep their hands busy. She is also perfect for babies and small children. Different stitches are used to give a lovely rippled and textured surface. Because Plush Baby Yarn is used, it is super soft! Different shaped buttons make for lots of interest. This is my teddy version of a twiddle muff.

You can sell your completed Elsie! Just credit me as the designer!

Elsie is 40cm or 16 inches when standing, and 30cm or 12 inches when sitting

Materials needed: 4.5mm or 7 US knitting needles, 40g or 1.4 oz of Red Heart Plush Baby in each of these colours: Blue (00004), Pink (00005), Green (00003) and Lemon (00002), stuffing, pink, blue, and yellow sewing cotton, 20mm googly eyes and clear adhesive
Buttons: green teddy bear, blue teddy bear, white butterfly, pink plain heart, green heart, lilac heart, blue heart, pink daisy, lilac rose, pink flower, and blue flower.

Methods used: Cast on using the thumb method, Knit or garter stitch, Purl, KFB - Knit into the front and the back of a stitch, K2tog - Knit 2 stitches together as 1, Cast off, Sew the pieces together using mattress stitch or the Bickford method.

There are a number of different stitch combinations that make up the different patterns on the teddy. To complete these stitch combinations, you will need to change the position of the yarn. For example, if you are told to (K1, P1, K1, P1): First knit one stitch. Then to purl the next stitch, you would take your yarn from the back to the front between your two needles. Purl the stitch. To knit the next stitch, you would take your yarn from the front to the back between your two needles. Knit the stitch. Then to purl the last stitch, you would take your yarn from the back to the front between your two needles again. Purl the stitch.

In loving memory of my grandmother, Elsie Thomas, who suffered from Alzheimers.

725660.name: For Phylis - Twiddle Muffs
725660.notes_html:
My Mom works with a group of ladies, crocheting for charity, occasionally I get blackmailed into writing patterns………
Twiddle muffs are fabulous for Dementia and Alzheimer patients and also for children with Autism.
My Ouma (granny in S.A) is now in a home with this awful disease so this one is for her

Material list

  • Any DK yarn of your choice
  • 4mm hook
  • Needle for sewing in ends
  • Ribbon
  • Buttons
  • Pom poms
  • Fluffy yarn
  • Crochet motifs
  • Charms and trinkets

If you are working your Twiddle Muff in thicker yarn, the pattern is worked in multiples of 4 and you can decrease your starting chain by 8 stitches to work a slightly smaller Twiddle Muff.

Visit my Facebook group for pattern support and other info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1370975902929963/

Visit my Facebook group for pattern support and other info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1370975902929963/

734027.name: Nursing Necklace
734027.notes_html:
Elevate your crochet skills with this delightful Nursing Necklace pattern, perfect for both beginners and seasoned crocheters. The slip stitch crochet technique used in this pattern creates a sturdy yet flexible fabric, making it safe for all ages. The detailed photo tutorial and written instructions ensure a smooth crafting experience, while the circular design adds a modern touch to your finished piece. Whether you’re making it for yourself or as a thoughtful gift, this Nursing Necklace pattern is sure to be a hit!.
Unique Features-

• Suitable for beginners
• Slip stitch crochet technique for durability
• Detailed photo tutorial and written pattern included
• Modern circular design

Materials Needed-

• Yarn: Bernat Maker Home Dec (Bulky weight, 7 WPI) - 5-10 yards (4.57-9.14 meters) required
• Stitch marker (optional)
• Hook: 6.5mm (US Size 10.5)

747622.name: Stroke Me Soother Twiddle Muff
747622.gauge_description: 6 stitches and 3 rows = 2 inches in UK Treble Crochet
747622.notes_html:
Stroke Me Soother Twiddle Muff

A crochet twiddle muff designed to give warmth and comfort to cold hands, and sensory stimulation to anyone living with symptoms of Alzheimer’s, Dementia, etc. to help to keep their hands occupied when they feel anxious or agitated.

I designed two patterns with some slight differences between them.

The larger one could also double up as a lap blanket as well as a really cosy hand and arm muff. The second one is smaller and designed just for hands and I added a number of rows of fur to the seam.

The yarn really makes this project The King Cole Yummy is velvet soft to the touch, and the Wendy Eider is just like stroking a soft kitten.

7338982.gauge_pattern: Gauge is not essential for this project
7338982.name: Amigurumi Breast
7338982.gauge_description: Gauge is not essential for this project
7338982.notes_html:
Amigurumi pattern of a realistic crocheted anatomical model of a human breast
This stuffed breast is projected for training moms on breastfeeding, so it’s an ideal gift for doulas, midwifes, obtetricians and lactation consultants. It’s also a cute soothing toy for new-borns and babies.
Or for any boob-lover, really!

DETAILS:

  • Skill level: absolute beginner
  • Pattern available in English (US terms), Spanish (Spain terms), Italian
  • The finished amigurumi measures aprox. 10 cm (4 inch) worked with a 3.5 mm hook
  • No sewing involved! 100% baby safe

MATERIAL NEEDED:
– 1 yarn ball for the nipple
– 1 yarn ball for the skin
– A 3.5 mm hook, or the most fitting hook for your yarn
– Stuffing
– Tapestry needle and stitch marker

7351496.gauge_pattern: Gauge not important for this pattern
7351496.name: Granny Square Fidget
7351496.gauge_description: Gauge not important for this pattern
7351496.notes_html:
Free version of this pattern is available on our website. The PDF pattern has a breakdown of each row / round and extra photos.

Feeling fidgety? Crochet this cute granny square with pony beads for a calming and entertaining experience. Perfect for all skill levels, this project combines relaxation with creativity. Granny Square Fidgets are perfect for Random Acts of Crochet Kindness and little gifts. Not only are the grannies fast to crochet, but they can be made with your stash of scraps.

This crochet pattern is written for beginners and neurodiverse crafters. The abbreviated instructions are followed by a breakdown in italics making it easier to understand what you need to do in each row. If you’ve had trouble reading patterns in the past, we hope that you’ll give our patterns a try! Available to purchase on Ravelry and our website.

Materials
Worsted weight yarn (Marvel 8 Ply)
- Grey
3.5mm crochet hook
Keyring (Optional)
Pony Beads – 9mm (12 beads)
Scissors
Tapestry needle

**Fox Creations** is a family-run crafty business based in Adelaide, South Australia. We love crafting and just about anything to do with yarn. Our mission is to help as many people as possible to access and enjoy the world of amigurumi and crochet. We’re committed to creating beginner-friendly patterns which have been developed in conjunction with neurodiverse crafters.

We are LGBTQIA+ friendly and believe in inclusivity and diversity within our community.

7358008.name: Octopus toy for premature babies
7358008.notes_html:
This adorable octopus is more than just a cute amigurumi; it’s a powerful symbol of support and love for premature babies.

Crocheting helps us calm our minds and heal our hearts, and the finished octopuses carry the potential to spread joy, love, and support. The tentacles provide comfort and a sense of security, reminding babies of the environment they were used to before birth. This little octopus is perfect for gifting to those who need a bit of encouragement or a reminder that they are cherished.

Skill Level: Beginner/Advanced Beginner
Size: Approximately 6.3 in = 16 cm long with tentacles, 8.3 in = 21 cm long with stretched tentacles
Materials Needed: Any color of 100% cotton yarn, 2 mm crochet hook, fiberfill stuffing, yarn needle, and scissors.

✨ Pattern Highlights:

8 pages of detailed, easy-to-follow instructions with accompanying 11 photos

Why Choose This Pattern?
As a meaningful amigurumi designer, I believe in the therapeutic power of crochet. Each of my designs is crafted with the intention of promoting mindfulness and healing. Along with the pattern, you’ll find tips and tricks to enhance your healing journey.

Instant Download:
Upon purchase, receive a PDF file with pattern instructions for immediate download, printing, and crafting.

Note: This listing is for a digital download only. The finished product shown in photos is for illustrative purposes.

Legal Notice:
Please note that this pattern is the intellectual property of KidUnique Crochet and is intended for personal use only. It is not to be distributed or resold in any form.

✨ Share Your Creations:
I would love to see the final result of your work! Share your creation with me on social media by tagging @KidUniqueCrochet and get 30% discount on your next order. Your support and creativity are greatly appreciated.

Happy crocheting!
